identificationModule.briefTitle: Walking Training With Partial Body Weight Support on Static and Dynamic Surfaces in Stroke Survivers
identificationModule.officialTitle: Walking Training With Partial Body Weight Support on Static and Dynamic Surfaces in Individuals With Hemiparesis Due to Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is evaluate the effects of walking training with partial body weight support on static (floor) and dynamic (treadmill) surfaces in individuals with hemiparesis due to stroke. For this purpose, two training protocols will be employed in three experimental groups: G1 will do the walking training with partial body weight support on static surfaces and G2 will do the walking training with partial body weight support on dynamic surfaces

armGroups.label: Static surface
armGroups.description: The subjects will do the walking training with partial body weight support on static surface. The will be submitted to three weekly training sessions of approximately 45 minutes each , for six weeks , totaling 18 sessions

armGroups.label: dynamic surface
armGroups.description: The subjects will do the walking training with partial body weight support on dynamic surface. The will be submitted to three weekly training sessions of approximately 45 minutes each , for six weeks , totaling 18 sessions

interventions.name: Static surface
interventions.description: During all session time the subject will walk on the floor with partial body weight support. This protocol will be repeated in all sessions.

interventions.name: Dynamic surface
interventions.description: During all session time the subject will walk on the treadmill with partial body weight support. This protocol will be repeated in all sessions.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in the gait velocity
primaryOutcomes.description: Speed at which subjects walked measured by the 10 meters test
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately after and six weeks after training cessation.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Body weight Distribution measured while subjects are in a static position on two force platforms.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately after and six weeks after training cessation.

secondaryOutcomes.description: a score was assigned for each everyday activity, according to the amount of assistance required to perform it. Measured by a clinical scale (Functional Independence Measure Scale.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately after and six weeks after training cessation.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured by a clinical scale (Fulgy Meyer).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately after and six weeks after training cessation.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured by the 6 minutes walking test
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately after and six weeks after training cessation.

otherOutcomes.description: Measured while subjects are walking at a comfortable speed
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately after and six weeks after training cessation.

otherOutcomes.description: Behavior of the Center of Pressure in gait and gait initiation measured by the force plates during the gait and gait initiation. Center of Pressure distance and seed displacement will be measured during the task.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately after and six weeks after training cessation.

otherOutcomes.description: Measured while subjects are walking at a comfortable speed
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately after and six weeks after training cessation.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* One-sided hemiparesis, No heart disease (or medical clearance to participate in the study), No orthopedic impairments and / or neurological symptoms that may alter the the gait, no history of thrombophlebitis or deep vein thrombosis, Ability to understand and follow verbal commands, Can walk alone or with canes of approximately 10 m; Spasticity degree mild to moderate in the affected lower limb with levels of classification between 0 and 2 in the Ashworth spasticity scale modified

Exclusion Criteria:

* Heart frequency increase more than 75% of the maximum or have any other general instability during training that may lead risk for the health during the training,

references.citation: Gama GL, Celestino ML, Barela JA, Forrester L, Whitall J, Barela AM. Effects of Gait Training With Body Weight Support on a Treadmill Versus Overground in Individuals With Stroke. Arch Phys Med Rehabil. 2017 Apr;98(4):738-745. doi: 10.1016/j.apmr.2016.11.022. Epub 2016 Dec 27.
